title: Openwork Menat

completeness.name: Good
completeness.description: Most data is approved, but records have not been fully vetted. Many objects have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: Jewelry for both life and death, the menat was originally associated with the goddess Hathor but later related to many other goddesses as well, as a symbol of protection, victory, life, birth, and rebirth. Here, these ideas are conveyed by double images (from left to right) of Mut, Sakhmet, and Hathor (or lsis-Hathor) below the sun, which is shown victoriously born/reborn as a child. Baboons, which are also hieroglyphs for "good" and "beautiful," praise his rising at dawn.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
